intro: Hieracium procerigenum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium procerigenum is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
